channel.title: Item.cfg?
channel.description:
username is right - go into item.cfg and use "search" and look for names like thses: Code: abyssal_whip dragon_chainbody dragon_sq_shield dragon_plate_legs dragon_plate_skirt
What?? item.cfg and use search?

item.title: Item.cfg?
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“Robed Ranger, post:1, topic:19920”][quote]username is right - go into item.cfg and use “search” and look for names like thses:

Code:

abyssal_whip
dragon_chainbody
dragon_sq_shield
dragon_plate_legs
dragon_plate_skirt
[/quote]

What?? item.cfg and use search?[/quote]
item.cfg is labled Item ( but is a cfg file) and its colorful! lol open it up and it will say item = (id) and thats the id number so do ::pickup(space)(item id)(space)(ammount of item if its noted)

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg?
item.dc:creator: @Laserous Laserous
item.description:
@Laserous wrote:

its a file in your source folder, open it with notepad and look for the item(s) you want, then get the 4-digit number, and if you’re using Mopar as your client (which I’m sure you are) The item list can be found in the All_IDs folder in Items.xml, open with your web browser.

In mopar just use “::pickup (4 numbers) (how many)” to have them spawn in your inventory.

Read full topic
